info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 7:18PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A line of gusty showers associated with a frontal boundary will impact portions of Hamilton, northwestern Warren, Fulton, western Schoharie, southeastern Herkimer and Montgomery Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 717 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northeast of Stratford, or 18 miles northwest of Gloversville, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gloversville, Johnstown, Cobleskill, Canajoharie, Indian Lake, Fonda, Speculator, Jefferson, Fort Plain, Dolgeville, St. Johnsville, Ephratah, Summit, Richmondville, Mayfield, Lake Pleasant, Wells, Stratford, Sharon Springs and Ames. This includes the following highways... Interstate 88 between exits 20 and 22. Interstate 90 between exits 28 and 29A. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
